project.description:
This project builds on 011-lounge-restyled and using div and span elements can divide the page into logical sections that can be styled individually.
div: helps you add logical structure to your pages. It is like a container.
new CSS property: + width: lets you specify the width of the element's contents area. + text-align: alignment for text and images
selecting descendants: + by using #elixirs h2 you are selecting the h2 elements within the element marked with id="elixirs"
In this example, it is added a div element on the elixirs section of the page and it is styled as a handout menu. It is given a non-default width, to let the browser know that we dont want it to occupy as much space as available. Therefore, it is given a tall rectangular appearance. Then, it is styled in known ways by giving it a margin, padding, background image, etc. Then it is used a new technique to select specific elements within a div container, by using the syntax #elixirs [element], as in #elixirs h2. This lets us style the h2 headings without affecting any other h2 within the page.
